intro: Helipterum pygmaeum, commonly known as the dwarf helipterum, is a small, flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions. It has a compact growth habit with hairy leaves and produces bright yellow or orange flowers. Helipterum pygmaeum is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal dunes.
